Class Album

java.lang.Object
app.model.Album
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Album extends Object implements Serializable
Represents an album containing photos. Provides functionality to manage photos, retrieve photos by various criteria, and handle album metadata such as name and date range. This class is serializable to allow persistence.
Author:
Reuben Thomas, Ryan Zaken
See Also:

      public Photo getPhoto(String path)
      Retrieves a photo by its file path.
      Parameters:
      path - the file path of the photo
      Returns:
      the photo if found, or null if not found

    • getPhotosByTag

      public Set<Photo> getPhotosByTag(Tag tag)
      Retrieves all photos in the album that have the specified tag.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      a set of photos with the specified tag

    • getPhotosInDateRange

      Retrieves all photos in the album that were taken within the specified date range.
      Parameters:
      start - the start of the date range
      end - the end of the date range
      Returns:
      a set of photos within the specified date range

    • addPhoto

      public void addPhoto(Photo photo)
      Adds a photo to the album.
      Parameters:
      photo - the photo to add
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if adding photos to the stock album is not allowed
      IllegalArgumentException - if the photo already exists in the album

    • removePhoto

      public void removePhoto(Photo photo)
      Removes a photo from the album.
      Parameters:
      photo - the photo to remove
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if removing photos from the stock album is not allowed

      public String getDateRange()
      Gets the date range of the photos in the album.
      Returns:
      a string representing the date range, or "No photos" if the album is empty
